item.title: Here's What Happens to Your World of Warcraft: Legion Remix Characters After the Event Ends
item.description:
World of Warcraft: Legion Remix is almost over, and ahead of its end, Blizzard has shared exactly what happens to their characters when they transfer over for the Midnight Pre-Expansion Update. Fans should be sure to log in to their Legion Remix characters before then to prepare them for the move, all while snagging a new World of Warcraft Feat of Strength achievement in the process.

Legion Remix is a limited-time game mode that began October 7, 2025. During the event, players could speed through the popular expansion, obtaining brand-new and hard-to-get cosmetics with ease, all while leveling their World of Warcraft characters exceptionally fast and earning tons of achievements. Sadly, Legion Remix won’t be around forever; the event wraps up with the arrival of the WoW: Midnight Pre-Expansion Update on January 20.

What Happens to WoW: Legion Remix Characters After the Event?

Now, World of Warcraft has come forth with more details about what happens to their Timerunner characters once Legion Remix is over. Fans will keep their characters and names, all of which will be automatically transferred over to the main World of Warcraft game. However, the following things will not be brought with them, and will be deleted:

  • Remix quests, including Infinite Research dailies
  • Remix items, including bags, summoning scrolls, and reputation tokens
  • Remix currencies, including Bronze used to buy rewards during the World of Warcraft event
  • Remix gear, which will be replaced by a full set of item level 102 gear
    • This gear is the strength of 655 gear before the Midnight item level squish
    • Lower-level characters will have their gear scaled down appropriately

That said, plenty of things will be kept when transferring as well, including:

  • All gold earned during the event, plus an additional 2,000
  • All Legion currencies, including Veiled Argunite and Order Resources
  • All obtained achievements and reputations
  • All non- Remix items and quests, including obtained Artifacts and Legion campaign progress
  • A full set of 30-slot bags and a 26-slot reagent bag

Hotbars and talent trees will be wiped as well, especially considering the drastic class changes coming in the WoW: Midnight Pre-Expansion Update.

Once the transfer is complete, the characters can be freely played as if they were never Timerunners, though players will need to own The War Within in order to log in to characters above level 70 as per usual. The WoW: Midnight Pre-Expansion Update arrives the same day characters are transferred, but the Twilight Ascension Pre-Patch event starts a week later, which should provide an awesome opportunity to score some catch-up gear before the new expansion releases.

World of Warcraft: Legion Remix Isn’t Over Quite Yet

There are still a few days left of Legion Remix , however, and World of Warcraft is making sure the event goes out with a bang. Fans who log into the game between now and the end of the event can earn the elusive “Cloudy With a Chance of Infernals” Feat of Strength achievement, and enjoy some of the zany chaos therein. The temporal anomaly above Dalaran has grown significantly larger, and the Lost Legion Infernals from the final phase have become Infernals of the End Times, who spawn far more frequently. Lastly, all characters have the Out of Time buff, which confers 50% bonus movement speed.

Before the end of Legion Remix , players should be sure to spend all of their Bronze, prioritizing items that can’t be obtained outside the event first, such as the Violet Spellwing mount, or difficult-to-obtain WoW items like the Nightmare and Chronos Weapon Enchantment Illusions. Fans who have already bought every item might want to consider spending their excess Bronze on extra copies of the Legion Remix -specific Housing decor items. While players will be able to buy them from Val’zuun in the sewers of Dalaran after the event, they will cost a lot of Order Resources and Veiled Argunite, making Legion Remix the best time to stock up.

World of Warcraft: Midnight

item.title: How to Find & Enter Underwater Caves in Hytale
item.description:
Hytale has many secrets for players to uncover, and one of the most well-guarded is the Underwater Caves , a special type of POI only available while exploring the depths of the seas. But swimming around without drowning is a challenge by itself, not to mention diving and exploring the sea floor.

So, if players want to learn how to find and access Underwater Caves in Hytale, they should check out this full guide that explains where they can spot these special locations, how to enter and exit them safely, and most importantly: all the loot they can find inside them.

Where To Find & How To Access Underwater Caves in Hytale

Underwater Caves are randomly spawned , like most of the POIs in Hytale, only that they appear in big lakes or near the coast (or islands). These will have a characteristic ' wall of dark blue water ' that players need to cross to be able to access.

These blocks of special water are actually a flow of current that goes inside the caverns , and can be climbed up and down to access these reservoirs of special materials.

But the problem is how to spot them without drowning . Hytale doesn't allow players to dive for too long underwater, and the 'breath' (oxygen) bar goes down really quickly.

Ideally, players would want to swim near the surface , then dive a little and look around the coastal areas for these characteristic patterns in the water blocks to discover the location of an Underwater Cave.

Inside these POIs, players will find all types of Coral, Seashells, Kelp, and of course, Ice (which is one of the main ingredients for the Slow Totem).

Players can also find the elusive Azure Kelp , needed to fabricate Portals inside these caves, as well as the Spiral Wood Logs and Spiral Tree Fruits, which can only be found in these special POIs.

Subscribe for deeper Hytale exploration secrets and tips

Crave more Hytale discoveries? Subscribe to the newsletter for deeper dives into undersea POIs, curated loot and crafting coverage, and broader exploration guides that build on what you already know.
By subscribing, you agree to receive newsletter and marketing emails, and accept Valnet’s Terms of Use and Privacy Policy. You can unsubscribe anytime.

Remember that accessing these caves often leads to landing on blocks that might shatter under the weight of the player, creating natural traps. If players are not careful, they can take tons of fall damage, so bring lots of Health Potions and recovery items.

Underwater Caves can also contain ruins of ancient civilizations, which are plagued with Undead and some of which might drop Essence of Ice, another of the items required to craft the Blue Crystal Staff, one of the Magic Weapons in Hytale.

It is worth noting that streams of water can be used as ladders to enter and exit underwater caves. That way, players can avoid taking fall damage or landing on brittle ice. Landing on water ponds inside the caves will also cushion the fall, preventing players from being hurt. But be careful, as not all water ponds inside the caves are deep enough to prevent fall damage.

item.title: 14 Disney Games Have Suddenly Been Delisted from Steam
item.description:
While Disney games tend to be hit or miss, some truly great ones do exist, not to mention that there are gamers out there who have a fondness for the movie and show tie-in games that can be found on platforms like Steam . Unfortunately, the selection of Disney games on Steam just took a drastic hit, with 14 games pulled from the marketplace on January 15.

While the internet’s current meme of choice Cory in the House DS is climbing its way to the top of the Metacritic rankings, those who unironically enjoy Disney video games woke up to disappointment today. The 14 games removed from Steam are as follows:

  • Afterlife
  • Armed and Dangerous
  • Cars Radiator Springs Adventures
  • Chicken Little Ace in Action
  • Disney Fairies: Tinker Bell’s Adventure
  • Disney’s Hercules
  • Disney Planes
  • Disney Winnie the Pooh
  • Finding Nemo
  • Lucidity
  • Phineas and Ferb: New Inventions
  • Stunt Island
  • The Princess and the Frog
  • Toy Story Mania

Some of these games have seemingly been removed from GOG as well (like Armed and Dangerous ) with Disney thoroughly scrubbing them from the internet.

Disney is unfortunately known for vaulting its content, a process that has led to some particularly frustrating game shutdowns over the years. Pirates of the Carribean Online , Toontown , and Club Penguin are some of the most popular Disney projects that were abandoned, though fan projects have kept a version of them up and running since the official support has ceased. Unfortunately for any fans of the above titles, their singleplayer focus makes it unlikely for them to be revived like Toontown or Club Penguin , so this sudden Steam removal is particularly problematic.

Which of Disney’s Removed Steam Games Are The Biggest Letdown?

Of the 14 games removed, some of the standouts are the original titles like Afterlife and Armed and Dangerous . The former was a 1996 Lucasfilm title where players were in charge of both Heaven and Hell, serving as a unique take on Sim City full of humorous disasters and interesting concepts. The latter isn't just what Bucky shouts when using his ultimate in Marvel Rivals ; Armed and Dangerous was a game that was also handled by Lucasfilm (as well as Planet Moon Studios), and was a comedic third-person shooter released in 2003 that parodied both fantasy and sci-fi. In the comments of the above Reddit post from Dry-Albatross-4121, many seemed particularly bummed that this game was removed, as they had no idea that it was even on Steam and wish they could experience its unique weaponry and characters again. While Afterlife has certainly shown its age, fans of city builders should still be able to play it if they so wish, and Armed and Dangerous holding up fairly well for a game that's over 20 years old makes its removal even more tragic.

Commenters are also urging players to purchase and download other standout Disney games, such as Split/Second , before they get removed from Steam as well.

Of the licensed games, many seem fond of Hercules and are sad to see it essentially become abandonware, locked behind piracy and old PS1 consoles. Whereas the SEGA Genesis version of Aladdin is infamous for being frustratingly hard, Hercules is known for being one of the better Disney tie-in games ever released. The game shined because of its visuals, music, and voice acting, all of which matched the quality of the movie. It successfully merged 16-bit and 32-bit games with its side-scrolling action, with collectibles also giving them a reason to explore the levels thoroughly. Sadly, this classic Disney game just became a lot less accessible.

Subscribe for deeper coverage of removed Disney games

Thinking about what the Steam removals mean for collectors and players? Subscribe to the newsletter for focused coverage, expert analysis, preservation context, and curated guidance on Disney and retro games to help you navigate availability issues.
By subscribing, you agree to receive newsletter and marketing emails, and accept Valnet’s Terms of Use and Privacy Policy. You can unsubscribe anytime.

As always, it’s worth noting that players who already own these delisted Steam games can still access them, with only those hoping to purchase them after their removal being impacted. Still, for anyone who didn’t already own these Disney games, it’s a huge disappointment to see them taken off Steam without any warning to purchase them before they’re gone.

5 Questions
Disney's Steam Purge: Test Your Knowledge on the Delisted Classics

0

item.title: 8 Upcoming 2026 Games That You Should Not Preorder
item.description:
Preordering video games can be a double-edged sword. While being able to secure a copy of a highly anticipated title in advance sounds good on paper, dropping money without being sure that the final product is going to live up to the hype or suit your preferences can be a huge gamble and lead to buyer's remorse.

2026 will be filled to the brim with many new games that are most likely going to be great (like Marvel's Wolverine or Resident Evil: Requiem ), and most people will have dozens of titles they will want to play. However, there are a few upcoming titles that people should not preorder or at least wait a bit longer to do so , not necessarily because they look like they will be bad, but rather because they’re seemingly so experimental or unpredictable that their quality or content is difficult to pin down.

We are talking about physical copies for consoles, as there is very little reason to preorder if you are going to pick up a digital copy on Steam or one of the stores.

Pragmata

Capcom Is Taking A Risk With A Distinct New IP

Pragmata
Action
Adventure
Third-Person Shooter
Systems
Released
April 24, 2026

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

Genre(s)
Action, Adventure, Third-Person Shooter
Powered by

Whenever a company as huge as Capcom decides to bet on a brand-new IP, it’s important to pay attention, and Pragmata definitely warrants it. This will be a unique third-person shooter in which the main character is accompanied by a small android girl who can hack and override the hostile machines they’re fighting in real time.

This premise is quite creative and brimming with potential, but the idea of interrupting the fast-paced combat to do some puzzles can be a tad overwhelming, and it can make it seem like the game is doing a bit too many things at the same time. Fortunately, there’s currently a Pragmata demo available on Steam, and it has been receiving positive reviews, so those who are interested can check it out ahead of the game’s April 2026 release date.

The Pragmata Sketchbook - Demo is specifically designed to introduce the combat; therefore, if you have a PC that can run it, give it a go before deciding whether this game might be for you or not.

Pokemon Pokopia

“Pokemon Meets Animal Crossing” Is A Bizarre Formula

Pokémon Pokopia
Life Simulation
Simulation
Systems
Released
March 5, 2026

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
Everyone / Users Interact, In-Game Purchases
Genre(s)
Life Simulation, Simulation
Powered by

While the Pokemon franchise has had many highs and many lows in the past few years, the announcement of a new spin-off for home consoles is always a defining moment for its fanbase, and Pokemon Pokopia is one of the most fascinating ones yet. This game will allow players to take control of a Ditto who transforms into a human and seeks help from other Pokemon to build and maintain a village where they can live together, without any trainers around.

Pokemon Pokopia is a life simulation game that looks like a crossover between Pokemon and Animal Crossing , which undoubtedly sounds very fun. That said, there is still a lot unknown about this project, and it is hard to predict whether the gameplay will deliver that simple but addictive loop synonymous with Animal Crossing . Pokemon spin-offs have, historically, been all over the place in terms of quality, so Pokopia could go either way.

Romeo Is A Dead Man

Suda51 Is The King Of Making Brilliant Games That Are Not For Everyone

Romeo is a Dead Man
Action
Science Fiction
Systems
Released
February 11, 2026

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

Genre(s)
Action, Science Fiction
Powered by

Romeo is Dead Man is the next hack-and-slash game by visionary developer Suda51, the creator of other bizarre action titles that can be considered cult classics, like No More Heroes , Lollipop Chainsaw , Killer7, and Killer is Dead . Truth be told, all of this new game’s trailers make it seem like it’ll be brimming with style and will feature multiple action-packed encounters against wacky bosses, so that's always relieving to know.

However, it's worth pointing out that most of Suda51’s games are very divisive and don’t appeal to absolutely everyone. Titles like Killer is Dead and Lollipop Chainsaw have been criticized for having surface-level combat that lacked depth or any real challenge, and Romeo is a Dead Man may fall into that practice as well. Moreover, last year, Suda51 collaborated with Swery for Hotel Barcelona, which was really polarizing and arguably a slight disappointment. It’s safe to say that he’s a very unpredictable developer, and even his most loyal fans should wait for a few reviews before giving Romeo is a Dead Man a shot.

007 First Light

The First AAA James Bond Game In 14 Years

007 First Light
Action
Adventure
Stealth
Systems
Released
May 27, 2026

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
Teen / Blood, Language, Violence
Genre(s)
Action, Adventure, Stealth
Powered by

James Bond fans have been waiting for something that could surpass GoldenEye 007 as the best video game adaptation in the franchise for literal decades, and IO Interactive’s upcoming title, 007 First Light, has the elements necessary to achieve that. Not only does it look really impressive graphics-wise, but it’s also being developed by a studio that has plenty of experience working on stealth games, seeing as they also made the most recent entries in the Hitman franchise.

007 First Light clearly has a high budget and has been in development for quite a long while, but its preview content has mostly just presented it as a traditional AAA third-person shooter. If that ends up being the case, that would not be a terrible thing by any stretch of the imagination, but it might not be exactly what all James Bond fans are craving. Fortunately, IO Interactive recently delayed its release date from March 2026 to May 2026, so hopefully it'll use those extra months of development to polish the game as much as possible.

Phantom Blade Zero

Is It A Hack-And-Slash? Is It A Soulslike? Or Is It Both?

Phantom Blade Zero
Action
RPG
Systems
Released
September 9, 2026

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
Unreal Engine 5
Genre(s)
Action, RPG
Powered by

Few things in the gaming industry are as enticing as a brand-new IP that looks extremely promising in the previews, and Phantom Blade Zero is a recent example. Developed by Chinese studio S-GAME, the first few trailers of this game made it look like a somewhat typical action game with a focus on melee combat and a muted art style. However, its release date trailer was a major improvement, as it showcased some high-octane action and over-the-top boss fights taking place in more vibrant environments.

While Phantom Blade Zero looks great now, its genre is not 100% clear yet; sometimes, it looks like a slow-paced “Soulslike,” while other times it looks like a fast-paced hack-and-slash title akin to Devil May Cry or Bayonetta . The final product might be a perfect blend of both genres (similarly to Stellar Blade), but both “Soulslike” fans and hack-and-slash fans should wait for reviews (or a public demo, if one is released) before making a final decision.

The Duskbloods

FromSoftware’s Nintendo Switch 2 Exclusive Has A Major Drawback

The Duskbloods
Action
Systems
Released
2026

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

Genre(s)
Action
Powered by

While Nintendo still hasn’t announced the official release date for FromSoftware’s upcoming Switch 2 exclusive, The Duskbloods , it’s still set to come out sometime in 2026. This game caught a lot of attention during the April 2025 Nintendo Direct, as it seems like it’s going to be a spiritual successor to Bloodborne , complete with Lovecraftian imagery and hunters who have to fight terrifying monsters.

Many hardcore FromSoftware fans are displeased with the idea of The Duskbloods being exclusive to the Nintendo Switch 2, but there’s another huge reason why most gamers should be careful when preordering it: The Duskbloods is a multiplayer game, similar to Elden Ring Nightreign . Of course, there’s nothing wrong with that, but most FromSoftware fans prefer single-player adventures, so this one might not be what they are looking for.

Tomb Raider: Legacy of Atlantis

What Exactly Is A Video Game Reimagining?

Tomb Raider: Legacy of Atlantis
Action
Adventure
Platformer
Systems
Released
2026

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

Genre(s)
Action, Adventure, Platformer
Powered by

2026 marks the 30th anniversary of the Tomb Raider franchise, and Crystal Dynamics will be celebrating it with the upcoming release of Tomb Raider: Legacy of Atlantis . Announced during The Game Awards 2025, this game has been marketed as a reimagining of the original title from 1996, complete with stunning modern graphics and more accessible modern controls.

Smarter preorder decisions: subscribe to our newsletter

Wondering whether to preorder, demo, or wait? Subscribing to the newsletter delivers focused coverage, demo recommendations, risk assessments, and review roundups to help you decide on experimental or high-hype 2026 game releases.
By subscribing, you agree to receive newsletter and marketing emails, and accept Valnet’s Terms of Use and Privacy Policy. You can unsubscribe anytime.

Legacy of Atlantis looks quite good and has the potential of being the long-awaited comeback that Tomb Raider truly deserves. However, it’s not exactly clear what the term “reimagining” means and how this title will be different from the existing remake, 2007’s Tomb Raider: Anniversary (which is among the more polarizing entries in the series) . Needless to say, Tomb Raider fans should wait for more info about Legacy of Atlantis to come out before thinking about preordering it.

Grand Theft Auto 6

The Most Anticipated Video Game Of All Time

Grand Theft Auto 6
Action
Adventure
Systems
Released
November 19, 2026

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
Rating Pending - Likely Mature 17+
Genre(s)
Action, Adventure
Powered by

There is a good chance that most people reading this list have either already preordered Grand Theft Auto 6 or are planning on buying it on day one. They certainly can’t be blamed, though, because the entire gaming community has been waiting for the next mainline entry in the GTA series since 2013, and, based on the few trailers and images that Rockstar has released, it seems like GTA 6 will be the most ambitious open-world sandbox game ever made.

However pessimistic it sounds, gamers should try to keep their expectations in check to an extent. The hype surrounding this sequel is so absurdly high that it could reach a point where it would become nearly impossible for Rockstar to live up to expectations. While the studio has already delayed it twice to ensure the final product will be as perfect as possible, we have seen almost no gameplay so far. Rockstar's track record suggests that Grand Theft Auto 6 will be a masterpiece, but nothing in gaming is guaranteed.

item.title: How to Get a Pet in Heartopia
item.description:
Adopting a pet in Heartopia is one of the most heartwarming milestones in the game, but it’s not something you can rush into on day one. Heartopia doesn’t hand you a companion right away. Instead, it encourages you to settle into town life, learn the core systems, and build routines. Once you’re ready, you can welcome a loyal dog or a cozy cat into your home plot. Read on to learn how to adopt pets in Heartopia .

How to Unlock Pets in Heartopia

To adopt your first pet in Heartopia , you need to reach D.G. Member Level 12. Once you do, the game will unlock a quest that leads you to Mrs. Joan and her Adoption Center.

Before pet care becomes available, you need to have already unlocked the five basic hobbies in Heartopia : Cooking, Gardening, Insect Catching, Bird Watching, and Fishing. Then, visit the Adoption Center. Mrs. Joan will ask for a Hobby Expansion Ticket. Handing this over unlocks Cat Caring first, and Dog Caring follows shortly after. You’ll have enough tickets to unlock both.

You don’t have to adopt both a cat and a dog immediately. You can just go home and come back later.

How to Get a Cat in Heartopia

To adopt a cat, speak to Mrs. Joan and choose the option about cats. You’ll be guided toward the three available cats in the adoption center. Walk up to a cat and interact with them. A bubble will appear above their head.

Tap on the bubble to view their ID card, which shows:

  • Breed
  • Gender
  • Personality traits (Energetic, Clingy, Sensitive, Sociable, Indifferent, etc.)

If you like the cat, hit the Adopt button. If not, close the window and move on to the next one. Once adopted, your cat is instantly transported to your home plot. You can track them anytime using the Pet Tab on your in-game smartwatch .

How to Get a Dog in Heartopia

Adopting a dog follows the same steps as adopting a cat, with one small twist: you need to start the cat dialogue first. After Mrs. Joan explains cats, talk to her again and ask about dogs.

Sign up for Heartopia pet guides in our newsletter

Subscribe to the newsletter for clear Heartopia pet coverage: adoption checkpoints, Hobby unlock tips for Cat and Dog Caring, and breed/personality breakdowns to help you choose. Also includes broader Heartopia guides.
By subscribing, you agree to receive newsletter and marketing emails, and accept Valnet’s Terms of Use and Privacy Policy. You can unsubscribe anytime.

Then, walk up to any of the three dogs to view their:

  • Breed
  • Gender
  • Personality traits

When you find your perfect pup, tap Adopt. Your dog will be sent straight to your home, and you can track them through the Pet Tab.

As you level up your Cat Caring and Dog Caring hobbies, Mrs. Joan gradually trusts you with more cuddly companions.

Heartopia
